lines.gurmukhi: dsvW pwiqSwh sRI gurU goibMd isMG swihb jI; sB QweIN hoie shwie [
lines.transliteration_english: dhasavaa(n) paatishaeh sree guroo gobindh singh saahib jee; sabh thaae'ee(n) hoe sahaae |

SGPC.translation: Then think of the tenth lord, revered Guru Gobind Singh, who comes to rescue everywhere.

lines.gurmukhi: dsW pwiqSwhIAW dI joq sRI gurU gRMQ swihb jI dy pwT dIdwr dw iDAwn Dr ky bolo jI vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: dhasaa(n) paatishaaheeaa(n) dhee jot sree guroo granth saahib jee dhe paatt dheedhaar dhaa dhiaan dhar ke bolo jee vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: The embodiment of the light of all ten sovereign lordships, the Guru Granth Sahib - think of the view and reading of it and say, "Waheguru".

lines.gurmukhi: pMjW ipAwirAW, cOhW swihbzwidAW, cwlHIAW mukiqAW, hTIAW, jpIAW, qpIAW, ijhnW nwm jipAw, vMf CikAw, dyg clweI, qyg vwhI, dyK ky Axif`q kIqw, iqnHW ipAwirAW, sicAwirAW dI kmweI dw iDAwn Dr ky, ^wlsw jI; bolo jI vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: panjaa(n) piaariaa(n), chouhaa(n) saahibazaadhiaa(n), chaalheeaa(n) mukatiaa(n), hatteeaa(n), japeeaa(n), tapeeaa(n), jihanaa(n) naam japiaa, vandd chhakiaa, dheg chalaae'ee, teg vaahee, dhekh ke aNaddi't keetaa, tinhaa(n) piaariaa(n), sachiaariaa(n) dhee kamaae'ee dhaa dhiaan dhar ke, khhaalasaa jee; bolo jee vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: Meditating on the achievement of the dear and truthful ones, including the five beloved ones, the four sons of the tenth Guru, forty liberated ones, steadfast ones, constant repeaters of the Divine Name, those given to assiduous devotion, those who repeated the Naam, shared their fare with others, ran free kitchen, wielded the sword and ever looked faults and shortcomings, say "Waheguru", O Khalsa.

lines.gurmukhi: ijnHW isMGW isMGxIAW ny Drm hyq sIs id`qy, bMd bMd ktwey, KoprIAW luhweIAW, crKVIAW qy cVy, AwirAW nwl icrwey gey, gurdvwirAW dI syvw leI kurbwnIAW kIqIAW, Drm nhIN hwirAw, is`KI kyswN suAwsW nwl inbwhI, iqnHW dI kmweI dw iDAwn Dr ky ^wlsw jI; bolo jI vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: jinhaa(n) singhaa(n) singhaNeeaa(n) ne dharam het sees dhi'te, bandh bandh kaTaae, khopareeaa(n) luhaae'eeaa(n), charakhaReeaa(n) te chaRe, aariaa(n) naal chiraae ge, guradhavaariaa(n) dhee sevaa le'ee kurabaaneeaa(n) keeteeaa(n), dharam nahee(n) haariaa, si'khee kesaa(n) suaasaa(n) naal nibaahee, tinhaa(n) dhee kamaae'ee dhaa dhiaan dhar ke khhaalasaa jee; bolo jee vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: Meditating on the achievement of the male and female members of the Khalsa who laid down their lives in the cause of dharma (religion and righteousness), got their bodies dismembered bit by bit, got their skulls sawn off, got mounted on spiked wheels, got their bodies sawn, made sacrifices in the service of the shrines (gurdwaras), did not betray their faith, sustained their adherence to the Sikh faith with sacred unshorn hair up till their last breath, say, "Waheguru", O Khalsa.

lines.gurmukhi: pMjW q^qW, srb`q gurduAwirAW dw iDAwn Dr ky bolo jI vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: panjaa(n) takhhataa(n), saraba't guradhuaariaa(n) dhaa dhiaan dhar ke bolo jee vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: Thinking of the five thrones (seats of religious authority) and all gurdwaras, say, "Waheguru", O Khalsa.

lines.gurmukhi: ipRQmy srb`q ^wlsw jI kI Ardws hY jI, srb`q ^wlsw jI ko vwihgurU, vwihgurU, vwihgurU ic`q Awvy, ic`q Awvn kw sdkw srb suK hovy [
lines.transliteration_english: prithame saraba't khhaalasaa jee kee aradhaas hai jee, saraba't khhaalasaa jee ko vaahiguroo, vaahiguroo, vaahiguroo chi't aave, chi't aavan kaa sadhakaa sarab sukh hove |

SGPC.translation: Now it is the prayer of the whole Khalsa. May the conscience of the whole Khalsa be informed by Waheguru, Waheguru, Waheguru and, in consequence of such remembrance, may total well-being obtain.

lines.gurmukhi: jhW jhW ^wlsw jI swihb, qhW qhW riCAW irAwieq, dyg qyg &qh, ibrd kI pYj, pMQ kI jIq, sRI swihb jI shwie, ^wlsy jI ky bol bwly, bolo jI vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: jahaa(n) jahaa(n) khhaalasaa jee saahib, tahaa(n) tahaa(n) rachhiaa(n) riaaeit, dheg teg phateh, biradh kee paij, panth kee jeet, sree saahib jee sahaae, khhaalase jee ke bol baale, bolo jee vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: Wherever there are communities of the Khalsa, may there be Divine protection and grace, and ascendance of the supply of needs and of the holy sword, protection of the tradition of grace, victory to the Panth, the succor of the holy sword, and ascendance of the Khalsa. Say, O Khalsa, "Waheguru".

lines.gurmukhi: is`KW nUµ is`KI dwn, kys dwn, rihq dwn, ibbyk dwn, ivswh dwn, Brosw dwn, dwnW isr dwn nwm dwn, sRI AMimRqsr jI dy ieSnwn, cONkIAw, JMfy, buMgy jugo jug At`l, Drm kw jYkwr, bolo jI vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: si'khaa(n) noon si'khee dhaan, kes dhaan, rahit dhaan, bibek dhaan, visaeh dhaan, bharosaa dhaan, dhaanaa(n) sir dhaan naam dhaan, sree anmritasar jee dhe eishanaan, chou(n)keeaa, jhandde, bunge jugo jug aTa'l, dharam kaa jaikaar, bolo jee vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: Unto the Sikhs the gift of the Sikh faith, the gift of the untrimmed hair, the gift of the disciple of their faith, the gift of sense of discrimination, the gift of truest, the gift of confidence, above all, the gift of meditation on the Divine and bath in the Amritsar (holy tank at Amritsar). May hymns-singing missionary parties, the flags, the hostels, abide from age to age. May righteousness reign supreme. Say, "Waheguru".

lines.gurmukhi: is`KW dw mn nIvW, mq au~cI, mq dw rwKw Awip vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: si'khaa(n) dhaa man neevaa(n), mat au'chee, mat dhaa raakhaa aap vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: May the Khalsa be imbued with humility and high wisdom! May Waheguru guard its understanding!

lines.gurmukhi: hy Akwl purK Awpxy pMQ dy sdw shweI dwqwr jIE [
lines.transliteration_english: he akaal purakh aapaNe panth dhe sadhaa sahaae'ee dhaataar jeeo |

SGPC.translation: O Immortal Being, eternal helper of Thy Panth, benevolent Lord,

lines.gurmukhi: sRI nnkwxw swihb qy hor gurduAwirAW gurDwmW dy, ijnHW qoN pMQ nUµ ivCoiVAw igAw hY, KulHy drSn dIdwr qy syvw sMBwl dw dwn ^wlsw jI nUµ bKSo [
lines.transliteration_english: sree nanakaaNaa saahib te hor guradhuaariaa(n) guradhaamaa(n) dhe, jinhaa(n) to(n) panth noon vichhoRiaa giaa hai, khulhe dharashan dheedhaar te sevaa sanbhaal dhaa dhaan khhaalasaa jee noon bakhasho |

SGPC.translation: Bestow on the Khalsa the beneficence of unobstructed visit to the free management of Nankana Sahib and other shrines and places of the Guru from which the Panth have been separated.

lines.gurmukhi: hy inmwixAW dy mwx, inqwixAW dy qwx, inEitAW dI Et, s`cy ipqw, vwihgurU [
lines.transliteration_english: he nimaaNiaa(n) dhe maaN, nitaaNiaa(n) dhe taaN, nioTiaa(n) dhee oT, sa'che pitaa, vaahiguroo |

SGPC.translation: O Thou, the honor of the humble, the strength of the weak, aid unto those who have none to rely on, True Father, Waheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: Awp dy hzUr ... dI Ardws hY jI [
lines.transliteration_english: aap dhe hazoor ... dhee aradhaas hai jee |

lines.gurmukhi: A`Kr vwDw Gwtw Bu`l cu`k mwP krnI [
lines.transliteration_english: a'khar vaadhaa ghaaTaa bhu'l chu'k maaf karanee |

SGPC.translation: Pardon any impermissible accretions, omissions, errors, mistakes.

lines.gurmukhi: syeI ipAwry myl, ijnHW imilAW qyrw nwm icq Awvy [
lines.transliteration_english: se'eee piaare mel, jinhaa(n) miliaa(n) teraa naam chit aave |

SGPC.translation: Grant us the association of those dear ones, on meeting whom one is reminded of Your Name.

lines.gurmukhi: nwnk nwm cVHdI klw, qyry Bwxy srb`q dw Blw [
lines.transliteration_english: naanak naam chaRhadhee kalaa, tere bhaaNe saraba't dhaa bhalaa |

SGPC.translation: O Nanak, may the Naam (Holy) be ever in ascendance! In Thy will may the good of all prevail!
